FuncDef:
The nat address-group bind-over-load command binds a common address pool to an overloaded address pool in a NAT instance.
The undo nat address-group bind-over-load command deletes the binding between a common address pool and an overloaded address pool in a NAT instance.
By default, no common address pool is bound to an overloaded address pool in a NAT instance.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a public IP address pool or an overloaded address pool.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After public IP addresses in a NAT address pool are used up, traffic of new users is dropped because no IP addresses are available. To prevent traffic loss, the overloaded IP address pool function is used to assign IP addresses to new users for NAT forwarding in the preceding situation. To bind a common address pool to an overloaded address pool in a NAT instance, run the nat address-group bind-over-load command. After addresses in the non-overloaded address pool are used up, addresses in the overloaded address pool can be used to perform NAT.
Prerequisites
An overloaded address pool has been configured.
Precautions
After a common address pool is bound to an overloaded address pool, the binding is mutually exclusive with the nat address-group exclude-ip-address and section exclude-ip-address commands.
The NAT instance in which the binding is configured cannot be configured as a load-balancing instance group.
Multiple public address pools in the same NAT instance can be bound to a single overloaded address pool.
The nat address-group bind-over-load command takes effect only on the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
